page.title: 06EISTEDDFODAU IN AMMANFORD
page.content: An Eisteddfod is an unique cultural competition which includes prose, poetry, singing, reciting, folk dancing, choral and instrumental. Also arts and crafts. The Royal National Eisteddfod is the supereme annual event, which was hosted by Ammanford in 1970. The Urdd Eisteddfod, which is for young people up to the age of 25, visited the town in 1957. Aelwyd Yr Urdd Penrhyd is most active in the town. It's membership for 1984-1985 was approximately 100 and meets weekly, when preporation for the eisteddfod copmetition is made. Penrhyd was formed from Aelwyd Penybanc and Ammanford in January 1984. The A.V.C.S. holds an eisteddfod to celebrate St.David's Day, the competition being between members of the 4 school houses.
